Class QueryResult

QueryResult
Direct Known Subclasses:
MSQueryResult, MyQueryResult, PgQueryResult, SyQueryResult
public class QueryResult

Class QueryResult is an abstract base class for query results; it holds all information on the result of a query processed after calling query on a Database-object.

isSuccess can be called to find out if the query actually worked or not. If not, the accompanying error message can be requested with getErrorMessage(). Note that the returned error message needn't necessarily be the same as the one returned after calling getErrorMessage() on the database connection object.

If the query performed was a SELECT-query, the following methods are useful:

  • getRowCount(): returns the number of rows in the result.
  • getRow($index, $type): returns the row at the specified index. $type is one of ECLIPSE_DB_NUM for an indexed result array, ECLIPSE_DB_ASSOC for an associative result array, or ECLIPSE_DB_BOTH for a combination of the first two. The default is ECLIPSE_DB_BOTH.

Alternatively, a QueryIterator can be used to process the rows in a selection query in a more generic way.

See Also:
Database, QueryIterator

Method Summary

          Clear the result data from memory; this method need only be called if memory usage is high in a single script.

Method Detail

clear

public void clear()
Clear the result data from memory; this method need only be called if memory usage is high in a single script. After calling this method, the result can no longer be accessed.

getDatabase

public Database getDatabase()
Get a reference to the database

getErrorMessage

public string getErrorMessage()
Get the error message; useful in case isSuccess() returns false. Returns the empty string if there was no error.

getResultId

public int getResultId()
Get the internal result identifier; this is a protected method.

getRow

public array getRow(var $index,
                    var $type)
Get the row at the specified index for a SELECT-query. The optional argument $type defines how the row should be retrieved: as an indexed array (ECLIPSE_DB_NUM), an associative array (ECLIPSE_DB_ASSOC) or as both an indexed and an associative array (ECLIPSE_DB_BOTH). The latter is the default.
Parameters:
$index - the index of the row to retrieve
$type - how the row should be retrieved
$type - Default Value: ECLIPSE_DB_BOTH

getRowCount

public int getRowCount()
Get the number of rows in the result for a SELECT-query

isSuccess

public bool isSuccess()
Check if the query was executed successfully
